content: Hello @T-lang -- just to clarify, we will hav a design meeting today! @Esteban K√ºber's writeup is here, you can also read #t-lang > MVP Generators use-case for more conversation.

(I am reminded that doc-oriented mtgs at Amazon sometimes open with the author giving an overview, but is soon followed by ‚Äúare there questions about the content of the doc‚Äù. I think the latter is what we are doing now, and I think it is worthwhile.)
What should the immediate follow up be on this? I will try to summarize and address as possible the points raised.

I think a usmmary would be great, to start. i feel like there were two main points from my memory:

  • prioritization
  • generality: how can we improve shortcomings of impl trait and make it so that using generators is not considered bad practice (make the idiomatic efficient)
to me, the latter is a question for the design process -- that's exactly the kind of questions we should be putting to a project group to work out

the former is important, and it's partly a question of "does pursuing this design block us from taking other immediate steps" -- honestly i thnk it's a question to hash out more in #wg-async-foundations than anything else
like, what are the demands on the lang team specifically when it comes to async or elsewhere
I will also say that we didn't spend much time on sync iterators but, to me, that's a big deal

one question I have regarding blog post: I'd like us to be getting feedback from others about whehtehr they'd find this feature useful and for what. Maybe we can run a survey? Internals thread is always an option too, but I think gathering the data via a form might be nicer. or maybe PRs to a repo.

I ran a short twitter thread. Although the numbers were interesting what I found more useful were the follow up conversations.
https://twitter.com/ekuber/status/1392608787568029703
